free: #e There was one...one man that gathered pears. The pear tree from which he gathered pears was well-fruited.
#c 有一個人採梨子。他採的那棵梨樹結實纍纍。
#e When he almost finished (gathering pears), the pears that were gathered almost made two baskets...
#c 當他幾乎要（採）完的時候，已經採了幾乎兩個籃子。
#e Several things/situations were seen/observed.
#c 看到的情況有許多
#e (First), there was one man passing by pulling a goat, and nothing happened/was done (by him).
#c (首先)，有一個人牽著一隻羊經過，沒（什麼）事發生/（他）沒做（什麼）事。
#e A while later/after that, a boy on a bike passed by, too.
#c 過了不久，有一個小孩也騎著腳踏車經過
#e This child saw plenty of pears which are on the ground.
#c 這個小孩看到許多梨子在地上
#e (Therefore), he stopped to check carefully and see (the fruit).
#c (因此)，他停下來仔細看（那些梨子）。
#e The thought of the child was probably like that he intended to steal (them).
#c 那小孩的想法或許是想要偷（那些梨子）
#e But he slightly saw the owner, who was staying above the tree picking pears.
#c 但是他看了一下主人，他還在上面採梨子。
#e He was somehow/a little bit afraid, and intended to take only a small part of them first and escaped.
#c 他有一點害怕，想要先拿走一些就離開。
#e Yet he noticed that the pear-picking man wasn't paying much attention to/looking carefully after the gathered pears on the ground.
#c 但是他發現採梨子的人沒在看那些採好放在地上的梨子。
#n 此處 lʉ 應為 alʉ (just.AF)。
#e Therefore, the child finally stole one basket (of the pears) straightforward, took it away, and went in some direction. (It was something) like that (way).
#c 因此，小孩最後直接偷走了一籃梨子，就那樣走了。

gloss: 否定.助動詞.非主焦.3SG.屬格
free: #e When the child was walking on the road, he didn't know where he would carry (the pears).
#c 當那小孩走在路上，他不知道要（將梨子）帶到哪裡去。
#e When he was on his way, carrying the stolen pears,
#c 他走在路上，帶著他偷來的梨子。
#e (he) happened to meet a girl who is similar with him.
#c 他碰巧遇見一個跟他一樣的女孩
#e (and) probably liked the girl.
#c 那男孩或許在喜歡那女孩
#e Therefore, while on the bike, the way/road was not carefully taken care of. Finally (he) bumped into a stone, and fell (down).
#c 因此，他在腳踏車上，沒有仔細看路，最後撞到石頭掉下來。
#e The pears were spilt all over the place/ground.
#c 梨子灑了一地
#n ine mio 兩詞合用為已固化之詞組(fixed expression)，語意為："那時候"。
#e when he wanted to pick them up,
#c 當他想要撿起梨子
#n 鄒語中有些在謂語位置，語意較像副詞的詞，常會接一no，再接主要謂語（動詞），結構就像 [[Adverbial + no]] + Verb]。這種用法不是普遍出現在所有像副詞性的詞上，而是只有部分副詞性的詞有此用法，像此句的akoeva no，而akoeva本身必須與no 連用，因此顯示這是某種定型化的用法。語料中的標記為NO。
#e Three children, the situation of the fallen child was seen by them.
#c 其他三個小孩，他們看見那個（男）孩跌下來。
#e The pears were put back/loaded again into the basket under/by their help(ing) together.
#c 他們一起幫忙檢梨子，梨子又被放回籃子裡。
#e When the three boys departed ((each other) with the other child),
#c 當那三個男孩（與男孩）分開，
#e a hat was seen (by them) laying on the ground/road.
#c 他們看到一頂帽子在地上

gloss: 助動詞.非主焦-3PL.屬格=完成

free: #e It was picked up (by them), and was returned to the owner (child).
#c (他們)撿起了帽子，還給主人那個小孩
#e The child was somehow grateful that he was helped by them.
#c 那孩子很高興他們幫他

gloss: 助動詞.非主焦-3PL.屬格=完成
助動詞.非主焦-3SG.屬格=完成

free: #e Therefore, the three children were each given a pear (by him).
#c 因此，他給每個小孩一個梨子
#e The three children seemed to have no idea which road they were going to pass,
#c 那三個小孩好像不知道要走哪條路
#e which happen to be the pass-by where the man gathered the pears.
#c 剛好（他們）經過那個採梨子的人

gloss: 助動詞.非主焦-3SG.屬格=完成

free: #e Then, the pear-gathering man seemed to have learned that one basket of the pears was missing.
#c 採梨子的人好像已經知道一籃梨子不見了

gloss: 助動詞.非主焦-3SG.屬格=完成

free: #e  (And) at that time he kept thinking of who might have stolen the pears.
#c 那時候他一直想是誰偷走了梨子
#e Just when he was thinking, the three children (happened to) passed by,
#c 就當他在想的時候，三個小孩剛好經過。
#e and each was holding with great joy a pear in hand.
#c 而且每一位都很高興的手裡拿著一顆梨子
#e The pear-owner must have realized/learned by guessing that  they probably stole/have stolen (the pears).
#c 梨子的主人已經猜到「或許是他們偷走了梨子」。
